00061 /* ************ Keyframing Management **************** */
00062 
00063 /* Get the active settings for keyframing settings from context (specifically the given scene) 
00064  *  - incl_mode: include settings from keyframing mode in the result (i.e. replace only)
00065  */
00066 short ANIM_get_keyframing_flags(struct Scene *scene, short incl_mode);
00067 
00068 /* -------- */
00069 
00070 /* Get (or add relevant data to be able to do so) the Active Action for the given 
00071  * Animation Data block, given an ID block where the Animation Data should reside.
00072  */
00073 struct bAction *verify_adt_action(struct ID *id, short add);
00074 
00075 /* Get (or add relevant data to be able to do so) F-Curve from the given Action. 
00076  * This assumes that all the destinations are valid.
00077  */
00078 struct FCurve *verify_fcurve(struct bAction *act, const char group[], const char rna_path[], const int array_index, short add);
00079 
00080 /* -------- */
00081 
00082 /* Lesser Keyframing API call:
00083  *  Use this when validation of necessary animation data isn't necessary as it already
00084  *  exists, and there is a beztriple that can be directly copied into the array.
00085  */
00086 int insert_bezt_fcurve(struct FCurve *fcu, struct BezTriple *bezt, short flag);
00087 
00088 /* Main Keyframing API call: 
00089  *  Use this when validation of necessary animation data isn't necessary as it
00090  *  already exists. It will insert a keyframe using the current value being keyframed.
00091  *  Returns the index at which a keyframe was added (or -1 if failed)
00092  */
00093 int insert_vert_fcurve(struct FCurve *fcu, float x, float y, short flag);
00094 
00095 /* -------- */
00096 
00097 /* Secondary Keyframing API calls: 
00098  *  Use this to insert a keyframe using the current value being keyframed, in the 
00099  *  nominated F-Curve (no creation of animation data performed). Returns success.
00100  */
00101 short insert_keyframe_direct(struct ReportList *reports, struct PointerRNA ptr, struct PropertyRNA *prop, struct FCurve *fcu, float cfra, short flag);
00102 
00103 /* -------- */
00104 
00105 /* Main Keyframing API calls: 
00106  *  Use this to create any necessary animation data, and then insert a keyframe
00107  *  using the current value being keyframed, in the relevant place. Returns success.
00108  */
00109 short insert_keyframe(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, struct bAction *act, const char group[], const char rna_path[], int array_index, float cfra, short flag);
00110 
00111 /* Main Keyframing API call: 
00112  *  Use this to delete keyframe on current frame for relevant channel. Will perform checks just in case.
00113  */
00114 short delete_keyframe(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, struct bAction *act, const char group[], const char rna_path[], int array_index, float cfra, short flag);

00116 /* ************ Keying Sets ********************** */
00117 
00118 /* forward decl. for this struct which is declared a bit later... */
00119 struct KeyingSetInfo;
00120 struct ExtensionRNA;
00121 
00122 /* Polling Callback for KeyingSets */
00123 typedef int (*cbKeyingSet_Poll)(struct KeyingSetInfo *ksi, struct bContext *C);
00124 /* Context Iterator Callback for KeyingSets */
00125 typedef void (*cbKeyingSet_Iterator)(struct KeyingSetInfo *ksi, struct bContext *C, struct KeyingSet *ks);
00126 /* Property Specifier Callback for KeyingSets (called from iterators) */
00127 typedef void (*cbKeyingSet_Generate)(struct KeyingSetInfo *ksi, struct bContext *C, struct KeyingSet *ks, struct PointerRNA *ptr); 
00128 
00129 
00130 /* Callback info for 'Procedural' KeyingSets to use */
00131 typedef struct KeyingSetInfo {
00132     struct KeyingSetInfo *next, *prev;
00133     
00134     /* info */
00135         /* identifier used for class name, which KeyingSet instances reference as "Typeinfo Name" */
00136     char idname[64];
00137         /* identifier so that user can hook this up to a KeyingSet (used as label). */
00138     char name[64];
00139         /* short help/description. */
00140     char description[240]; /* RNA_DYN_DESCR_MAX */
00141         /* keying settings */
00142     short keyingflag;
00143     
00144     /* polling callbacks */
00145         /* callback for polling the context for whether the right data is available */
00146     cbKeyingSet_Poll poll;
00147     
00148     /* generate callbacks */
00149         /* iterator to use to go through collections of data in context
00150          *  - this callback is separate from the 'adding' stage, allowing 
00151          *    BuiltIn KeyingSets to be manually specified to use 
00152          */
00153     cbKeyingSet_Iterator iter;
00154         /* generator to use to add properties based on the data found by iterator */
00155     cbKeyingSet_Generate generate;
00156     
00157     /* RNA integration */
00158     struct ExtensionRNA ext;
00159 } KeyingSetInfo;

00167 /* mode for modify_keyframes */
00168 typedef enum eModifyKey_Modes {
00169     MODIFYKEY_MODE_INSERT = 0,
00170     MODIFYKEY_MODE_DELETE,
00171 } eModifyKey_Modes;
00172 
00173 /* return codes for errors (with Relative KeyingSets) */
00174 typedef enum eModifyKey_Returns {
00175         /* context info was invalid for using the Keying Set */
00176     MODIFYKEY_INVALID_CONTEXT = -1,
00177         /* there isn't any typeinfo for generating paths from context */
00178     MODIFYKEY_MISSING_TYPEINFO = -2,
00179 } eModifyKey_Returns;
00180 
00181 /* poll the current KeyingSet, updating it's set of paths (if "builtin"/"relative") for context changes */
00182 short ANIM_validate_keyingset(struct bContext *C, ListBase *dsources, struct KeyingSet *ks);
00183 
00184 /* use the specified KeyingSet to add/remove various Keyframes on the specified frame */
00185 int ANIM_apply_keyingset(struct bContext *C, ListBase *dsources, struct bAction *act, struct KeyingSet *ks, short mode, float cfra);

00228 /* Low-level call to add a new driver F-Curve. This shouldn't be used directly for most tools,
00229  * although there are special cases where this approach is preferable.
00230  */
00231 struct FCurve *verify_driver_fcurve(struct ID *id, const char rna_path[], const int array_index, short add);

00235 /* Returns whether there is a driver in the copy/paste buffer to paste */
00236 short ANIM_driver_can_paste(void);

00238 /* Main Driver Management API calls:
00239  *  Add a new driver for the specified property on the given ID block
00240  */
00241 short ANIM_add_driver(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, const char rna_path[], int array_index, short flag, int type);
00242 
00243 /* Main Driver Management API calls:
00244  *  Remove the driver for the specified property on the given ID block (if available)
00245  */
00246 short ANIM_remove_driver(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, const char rna_path[], int array_index, short flag);
00247 
00248 /* Main Driver Management API calls:
00249  *  Make a copy of the driver for the specified property on the given ID block
00250  */
00251 short ANIM_copy_driver(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, const char rna_path[], int array_index, short flag);
00252 
00253 /* Main Driver Management API calls:
00254  *  Add a new driver for the specified property on the given ID block or replace an existing one
00255  *  with the driver + driver-curve data from the buffer 
00256  */
00257 short ANIM_paste_driver(struct ReportList *reports, struct ID *id, const char rna_path[], int array_index, short flag);

00259 /* ************ Auto-Keyframing ********************** */
00260 /* Notes:
00261  * - All the defines for this (User-Pref settings and Per-Scene settings)
00262  *  are defined in DNA_userdef_types.h
00263  * - Scene settings take presidence over those for userprefs, with old files
00264  *  inheriting userpref settings for the scene settings
00265  * - "On/Off + Mode" are stored per Scene, but "settings" are currently stored
00266  *  as userprefs
00267  */
00268 
00269 /* Auto-Keying macros for use by various tools */
00270     /* check if auto-keyframing is enabled (per scene takes presidence) */
00271 #define IS_AUTOKEY_ON(scene)    ((scene) ? (scene->toolsettings->autokey_mode & AUTOKEY_ON) : (U.autokey_mode & AUTOKEY_ON))
00272     /* check the mode for auto-keyframing (per scene takes presidence)  */
00273 #define IS_AUTOKEY_MODE(scene, mode)    ((scene) ? (scene->toolsettings->autokey_mode == AUTOKEY_MODE_##mode) : (U.autokey_mode == AUTOKEY_MODE_##mode))
00274     /* check if a flag is set for auto-keyframing (per scene takes presidence) */
00275 #define IS_AUTOKEY_FLAG(scene, flag) \
00276     ((scene)? \
00277         ((scene->toolsettings->autokey_flag & AUTOKEY_FLAG_##flag) || (U.autokey_flag & AUTOKEY_FLAG_##flag)) \
00278      : \
00279         (U.autokey_flag & AUTOKEY_FLAG_##flag))
00280 
00281 /* auto-keyframing feature - checks for whether anything should be done for the current frame */
00282 int autokeyframe_cfra_can_key(struct Scene *scene, struct ID *id);
00283 
00284 /* ************ Keyframe Checking ******************** */
00285 
00286 /* Lesser Keyframe Checking API call:
00287  *  - Used for the buttons to check for keyframes...
00288  */
00289 short fcurve_frame_has_keyframe(struct FCurve *fcu, float frame, short filter);
00290 
00291 /* Main Keyframe Checking API call:
00292  * Checks whether a keyframe exists for the given ID-block one the given frame.
00293  *  - It is recommended to call this method over the other keyframe-checkers directly,
00294  *    in case some detail of the implementation changes...
00295  *  - frame: the value of this is quite often result of BKE_curframe()
00296  */
00297 short id_frame_has_keyframe(struct ID *id, float frame, short filter);
00298 
00299 /* filter flags for id_cfra_has_keyframe 
00300  *
00301  * WARNING: do not alter order of these, as also stored in files
00302  *  (for v3d->keyflags)
00303  */
00304 typedef enum eAnimFilterFlags {
00305         /* general */
00306     ANIMFILTER_KEYS_LOCAL   = (1<<0),       /* only include locally available anim data */
00307     ANIMFILTER_KEYS_MUTED   = (1<<1),       /* include muted elements */
00308     ANIMFILTER_KEYS_ACTIVE  = (1<<2),       /* only include active-subelements */
00309     
00310         /* object specific */
00311     ANIMFILTER_KEYS_NOMAT       = (1<<9),       /* don't include material keyframes */
00312     ANIMFILTER_KEYS_NOSKEY      = (1<<10),      /* don't include shape keys (for geometry) */
00313 } eAnimFilterFlags;
00314 
00315 /* utility funcs for auto keyframe */
00316 int ED_autokeyframe_object(struct bContext *C, struct Scene *scene, struct Object *ob, struct KeyingSet *ks);
00317 int ED_autokeyframe_pchan(struct bContext *C, struct Scene *scene, struct Object *ob, struct bPoseChannel *pchan, struct KeyingSet *ks);

00320  * defined in python script: keyingsets_builtins.py */
